intro: Tricalysia ligustrina, commonly known as the African snowbell, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its ornamental white flowers that resemble bells. The plant has opposite, simple leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. It produces small, round fruits that contain one or two seeds. Tricalysia ligustrina is often cultivated for its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
